item.title: nishtman add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: nishtman add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: nishtman add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: nishtman add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: nishtman add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "But who prays for Satan? Who, in eighteen centuries, has had the common humanity to pray for the one sinner that needed it most?" -- mark twain

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but ... life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The darker the night, the brighter the stars, The deeper the grief, the closer is God!" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: nishtman add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
